snippet: Sluggish economic growth seems to be with investors for the long haul. So portfolio managers, noting record corporate profits, are puzzling out ways for shareholders to benefit.
abstract: Many economists and investment advisers find themselves resigned to world with persistently low growth; mutual fund portfolio managers, noting record corporate profits, are puzzling out ways for shareholders to benefit; they are looking for stocks that can shine even in slow economy.
lead_paragraph: Sluggish economic growth seems to be with investors for the long haul. So portfolio managers, noting record corporate profits, are puzzling out ways for shareholders to benefit.

headline.seo: A Low-Growth World Can Also Mean High Profits
headline.main: A Low-Growth World Can Also Mean High Profits
headline.print_headline: A Low-Growth World Can Also Mean High Profits
